entries.meaning: A type of grain, Eleusine coracana, cultivated as a cereal in arid areas of Africa and Asia; finger millet.
examples: Synonyms: African finger millet, caracan millet, finger millet, koracan

description: From Malay ragi (“fermenting medium, yeast”), from an Indian language such as Hindi रागी (rāgī, “finger millet”), since finger millet can be fermented. See Etymology 1.

entries.meaning: (cooking, brewing) A type of yeast traditionally used in winemaking, baking, and brewing, now identified as Saccharomyces cerevisiae.
